intro: Tropaeolum pubescens, commonly known as the pepperleaf nasturtium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its heart-shaped, hairy leaves and vibrant yellow or orange flowers. The plant produces edible, peppery-tasting seeds that are often used in cooking. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardeners. Its ornamental value and culinary uses make it a versatile and attractive plant.
